## Description
Provide a detailed description of the feature you're requesting. Include any specific goals or problems this feature aims to address.

## Problem Statement
Describe the problem or need that this feature would solve. Why is this feature important? Who would benefit from it?

## Proposed Solution
Explain how you envision the feature working. Include any specifics about behavior, design, or functionality.

## Alternatives Considered
List any alternative solutions or workarounds you've considered. Explain why these alternatives may not be sufficient.

## Additional Context
Include any relevant details, links to screenshots, diagrams, or documentation that may help understand the request. If applicable, provide references to similar features in other projects.

## Definition of Done (Dev)
This section is for developer who will work on this issue. You can leave this section as it is.

Outline the specific criteria that indicate when this feature can be considered "done." Examples include:
- [ ] All specified functionality is implemented and working.
- [ ] Code is reviewed and approved.
- [ ] Relevant documentation is updated.
- [ ] Unit tests and integration tests are passing.
- [ ] ... other ...

## How to Test (Dev)
This section is for developer who will work on this issue. You can leave this section as it is.

Provide steps or guidelines for testing the feature once it's implemented. This could include:
- [ ] Steps for setting up the testing environment.
- [ ] Specific scenarios and inputs to test.
- [ ] Expected outcomes for each test case.
- [ ] ... other ...
